articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - June 4, 2025 | Pods 19, 20, 23, 25 - Explore minor upgrades
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - June 4, 2025 | Pods 19, 20, 23, 25 - Explore minor upgrades
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for some Explore customers for one (1) day on June 4, 2025 during the time listed below.

Affected products: Explore

Important:  Customers can still run queries in Explore during the maintenance window.

Customers Affected: Only a subset of customers in the Pods listed below will be impacted by this maintenance program. Owners and Admins of those impacted accounts will be informed via a service notification banner in Zendesk Support that will appear on May 22, 2025 to June 4, 2025.

Expected behavior: Some Zendesk Explore customers will experience a delay in data refresh, which will become noticeable 1 hour after the maintenance starts and is expected to last 1.5 hours.

Please note that backend data ingestion processes will still occur without issue. The Explore reporting UI and data export features will still be available and Explore real-time dashboards will continue to update as usual. This reduces the impact customers will experience during the maintenance window. 

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Explore team is upgrading our databases for increased reliability, security and performance.

articles.name: Service Incident - May 21st, 2025
articles.title: Service Incident - May 21st, 2025
articles.body:
SUMMARY

May 21, 2025 07:18 AM UTC | May 21, 2025 12:18 AM PT
We are pleased to confirm that the issue affecting Support, which caused some customers to receive the error message “Message couldn’t be loaded,” has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding while our team worked to address this.

May 21, 2025 06:08 AM UTC | May 20, 2025 11:08 PM PT
Our engineering team has resolved the issue. Our engineers immediately performed a rollback to resolve the issue. To ensure the fix takes effect on your end, please perform a hard refresh or clear your cache and cookies. Thank you for your patience and cooperation. A final update will be provided shortly.

May 21, 2025 05:54 AM UTC | May 20, 2025 10:54 PM PT
We are currently aware of an issue in Support where customers are encountering the error message, "Message couldn’t be loaded." Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the problem. We will provide an update within the next 30 minutes.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Announcing an event log for custom object records
articles.title: Announcing an event log for custom object records
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
May 20, 2025 May 20, 2025 May 21, 2025

Zendesk is excited to announce that a changes to custom object records are now captured in an event log in Agent Workspace.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Custom object records contain a lot of important custom data. Previously, it was difficult to identify when and how changes to a record were made. Now, each record includes an Events tab, which displays a log of all updates to the record made by users and triggers after May 20, 2025. Events include field values that are added, removed, or changed.

For more information, see Viewing custom object record events.

Note: Record events that occurred prior to May 20, 2025 aren't visible on the Events tab.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk heard from customers that more visibility into record changes was essential. This feature is designed to help admins understand what changes were made to custom object records, when the changes occurred, and by whom.

What do I need to do?

You don't need to do anything. Record changes will begin appearing after May 20, 2025 for all accounts using custom objects.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-05-16
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-05-16
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • AI agents and knowledge
  • Copilot
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

AI agents and knowledge

AI Agents Advanced

New:
  • Navigating out of the Procedure page: We’ve made a minor UX improvement, making it easier to navigate out of a procedure page back to the use case page.
  • New procedure editor: We've updated the text editor for procedures in preparation for new features coming soon and to tackle minor UX issues, such as:
    • Copy/paste now works properly between procedures.
    • Solved some minor bugs (jumping cursor, actions containing special characters in the name, pasting on an empty text area).
    • Undo and redo work properly with rich content.
  • Default Search Rules: While we don't currently support multiple search rules, the gen3 RAG Agent will now use and respect the default search rule.
  • Agentic AI Agents now support Markdown and HTML formatting.
  • New escalated status for AI Agents Advanced email automation is being rolled out.
  • Conversation log filters for labels and intents support selecting AND and OR operators.
  • Drag-and-drop interactions can reorder actions applied to blocks, use cases, and AI agent events.
  • Edited web crawler knowledge source configurations can be saved as expected without issues from the page limit field.


Fixed:

  • Unsupported language reply: When linking a dialogue from the “Welcome reply” to a “Procedure” without an “Active language” being set for the conversation, the conversation sometimes got confused and triggered the unsupported language reply. This has been fixed.
  • Fixed a bug that prevented Link to blocks with auto-select settings from being copy-pasted in the dialogue builder.
  • Fixed an issue that allowed the BSAT system reply to be copied as a template.
  • Fixed a localization issue that caused the "Test production" button in the integration builder to be truncated in some languages.

Copilot

New:

Auto assist:

  • The tone of voice generative AI writing tool has been released.

Intelligent triage: 

  • You can now track sentiment and intent throughout the ticket lifecycle.

Fixed:

Intelligent triage:

  • Improved the intent model to better differentiate spam and feedback tickets.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Submitter History (Support)(paid)
    • Display all tickets submitted by your users from your ticket sidebar. Submitter History displays a real-time list of all open, pending, on hold, and new tickets created by the current agent on behalf of the customer, right inside the ticket sidebar. Whether you're following up on a customer issue or checking the status of previously submitted tickets that may not belong to your group or organization, Submitter History makes it fast and effortless.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Chat and messaging
  • Talk
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA
  • Zendesk WFM

articles.name: Why do agents get a two-factor authentication prompt after I deactivated it?
articles.title: Why do agents get a two-factor authentication prompt after I deactivated it?
articles.body:
Question

I turned off two-factor authentication on my account. Why do agents still get the two-factor authentication prompt to sign in?

Answer

When you turn off two-factor authentication at the account level, this action doesn't automatically deactivate it for all agents. If agents have turned on two-factor authentication individually through their profile in Zendesk Support, it will remain active for them even when an admin turns it off at the account level.  

To completely deactivate two-factor authentication, instruct your agents to turn off this feature from their profile. Agents can navigate to their profile and turn it off in the Security Settings tab. 

Admins can track who's using two-factor authentication by generating a 2FA status report. For more information, see this article: Using two-factor authentication to sign in to Zendesk Support.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - June 10-13, 2025 | Pod 20 | Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - June 10-13, 2025 | Pod 20 | Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for notified customers on Pod 20 on June 10-13 2025, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Messaging & Sunshine Conversations

Important:  Only customers with who have been notified and have Messaging enabled will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below. Impacted customers will receive a notification banner in their Support product on May 15.
Customers Affected: Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations customers on Pod 20 who have been notified, will experience a service disruption of 40 minutes at some time within the 40 minute maintenance window.

Expected behavior: During the maintenance window, notified accounts attempting to use Messaging will be locked and unable to send outbound messages; instead, they will receive an HTTP 423 response. Messages sent by end-users via social messaging channels for these accounts will be preserved and buffered until the account is unlocked.

What do customers have to do? If customers have enabled their own client-side Content Security Policy, they must include *.zendesk.com on their allowlist to ensure that their integrations continue to initialize and function.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is rehoming customers accounts to be located in the same data store as their Support accounts increased reliability, performance, and data locality.

articles.name: Announcing inactive messaging conversation reminders for end users
articles.title: Announcing inactive messaging conversation reminders for end users
articles.body:
Zendesk is pleased to announce the release of inactive messaging conversation reminders, an addition to the capacity release setting in messaging. 

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

We are adding automatic reminders to the capacity release feature in messaging, which lets you  send up to three nudges to end users, encouraging them to respond to the inactive conversation, and resolves the ticket if no response is received.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

When an agent is engaged in a conversation with an end user, there are instances where the end user may leave without confirming that the issue has been resolved. This lack of clear communication can leave the agent uncertain about whether the issue is resolved, negatively impacting customer service efficiency. 

This can lead to several challenges: 

  • Extended resolution time: Agents may waste time following up with users to reach a resolution, resulting in unresolved tickets and negatively affecting average resolution times.
  • Longer wait times: Accumulated unresolved tickets increase wait times for customers, prolonging their wait for assistance and contributing to a frustrating experience.
  • Operational inefficiency: Uncertainty about conversation statuses can lead to inefficient resource use, with some agents waiting for end-user responses while others are busy with active interactions.

What do I need to do?

Accounts created after May 19, 2025, have inactivity reminders turned on by default. Existing accounts will need to turn on and configure agent capacity settings to use the feature. See Automatically releasing agent capacity for inactive messaging conversations for more information.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Ensuring dark mode compatibility for your Zendesk Support apps
articles.title: Ensuring dark mode compatibility for your Zendesk Support apps
articles.body:
Audience: This article is for Zendesk customers using Support apps.

As Zendesk supports dark mode, it's important that the apps you use also support it to maintain a consistent and visually comfortable workspace. If an app doesn’t support dark mode, it may appear with bright or mismatched visuals that can be distracting or harder to use. 

This article will help you understand what steps to take based on how your app was created or acquired. 

This article includes these sections:

  • Scenario 1: App installed from the Zendesk Marketplace
  • Scenario 2: App developed internally by your team
  • Scenario 3: App built by Zendesk Professional Services
  • Additional tips
     

Scenario 1: App installed from the Zendesk Marketplace

What to do 
If you installed the app from the Zendesk App Marketplace, the responsibility for dark mode support lies with the app developer.

Steps to take

  1. Visit the app’s page in the marketplace.
  2. Scroll to find the “Contact Us” link.
  3. Reach out to the developer to request dark mode support or inquire about planned updates.
Tip: When contacting the developer, mention your current Zendesk theme setting (light or dark) and share screenshots if possible. This helps them prioritize and troubleshoot effectively.

Scenario 2: App developed internally by your team

What to do
Your internal development team will need to update the app to support dark mode using Zendesk’s development guidelines.

Steps to take

  1. Direct your developers to Supporting dark mode in the Zendesk developer documentation.
  2. Ensure the app uses the latest version of the Zendesk Garden design system, which includes built-in support for dark mode.

If your app doesn't use the Garden component, you can import @zendeskgarden/react-theming from Garden to access the full color theme.

Tip: Ask your developers to test the app in both light and dark modes to ensure proper behavior before deploying changes.

Scenario 3: App built by Zendesk Professional Services

What to do
Zendesk Professional Services builds custom apps for customers. If they created your app, they can help update it for dark mode.

Steps to take

  1. Reach out to your Zendesk account representative or customer success manager.
  2. Mention that you’re using dark mode and would like assistance with updating your custom app.
Tip: If you’re unsure whether Zendesk built the app, check your project documentation or reach out to Zendesk support for clarification.

Additional tips

  • How do I know if an app supports dark mode? Switch the profile menu of your Zendesk instance to dark mode and observe the app's appearance. If the app looks out of place (for example, overly bright or unreadable), it likely doesn't support dark mode.
  • Can I force dark mode in an unsupported app? Not reliably. If an app isn’t designed for dark mode, forcing dark styles may cause functionality or visibility issues.
  • Still not sure who built the app? Visit the Admin Center > Apps and Integrations > Apps page. The app name and configuration details can help identify whether it's installed from the Marketplace, built internally, or built by Zendesk.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - June 3-6, 2025 | Pod 25 | Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations

articles.name: Error: There was an error processing your request
articles.title: Error: There was an error processing your request
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

When I use a private window in Firefox, attempts to create a ticket from a Web Widget (Classic) fail with the error There was an error processing your request. Please try again later when an account is host-mapped.

Resolution steps

This is due to Firefox's use of the anti-tracking blocklist provided by disconnect.me. Despite attempts to appeal disconnect.me's decision, this platform keeps Zendesk listed as a tracker. As a workaround, use any of the other supported browsers.

For more information, see this article: Browsers supported by help center

articles.name: Service Incident - May 13th, 2025

articles.name: About Zendesk for Contact Center
articles.title: About Zendesk for Contact Center
articles.body:
Zendesk for Contact Center is an advanced, AI-powered, and enterprise-ready voice solution that makes it easy for your agents to deliver voice service without switching between tools.

Built on Amazon Connect, it offers enterprise-grade reliability, scalability, and security with crystal-clear conversations every time. It's enhanced with AI tools like real-time sentiment analysis and automated transcription.

Zendesk for Contact Center is formerly known as Engage Voice for Zendesk by Local Measure.

Key features of Zendesk for Contact Center

Zendesk for Contact Center has the following key features:

  • Real-time sentiment analysis: Detect customer emotions to resolve issues faster.
  • Automated transcription: Instant call summaries for accurate documentation.
  • Voice AI and automation: Smart IVR, call deflection, and multi-modal support that empower customers to self-serve while freeing agents for high-value interactions.
  • Pause/resume recording: Maintain compliance without disrupting workflows.
  • Proactive outreach: Keep customers informed before they need to reach out, with a predictive dialer that maximizes efficiency and ensures every call counts.
  • AI-powered after-call work: Automates repetitive post-call tasks to reduce agent workload and speed up resolutions.

Benefits of using Zendesk for Contact Center

Using Zendesk for Contact Center provides support organizations with the following benefits:

  • Faster call resolutions: Reduce average handling time by automating repetitive tasks and empowering agents with real-time insights.
  • Higher customer satisfaction: Proactive engagement and crystal-clear conversations lead to improved CSAT and stronger customer loyalty.
  • Increased agent productivity: AI-powered tools like automated after-call work and sentiment analysis help agents focus on solving customer issues.
  • Scalable for growth: : Seamlessly grow from small deployments to enterprise-wide solutions without losing performance or reliability.
  • ROI: Outbound efficiencies, reduced churn, and faster resolutions deliver tangible cost savings and revenue growth.

Zendesk for Contact Center also helps alleviate common pain points of delivering voice service, including:

  • Disconnected CX platforms, where customers repeat themselves and agents have to constantly switch between tools. Zendesk for Contact Center provides unified voice and digital channels within the Zendesk user interface.
  • Long call handling times, where inefficient processes lead to frustrated customers. Zendesk for Contact Center provides AI-driven after-call work that reduces manual tasks.
  • No real-time call insights, which lead to missed opportunities to resolve issues faster. Zendesk for Contact Center provides real-time sentiment analysis that empowers agents to adjust to live calls.
  • Outdated voice platforms, which have scalability and reliability issues during call surges. Zendesk for Contact Center is built on Amazon Connect, ensuring elastic scalability.

‍

articles.name: Announcing the ability to track sentiment and intent throughout the ticket lifecycle
articles.title: Announcing the ability to track sentiment and intent throughout the ticket lifecycle
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
May 15, 2025 May 19, 2025 May 23, 2025

Zendesk is pleased to announce that customers using intelligent triage will have the ability to track sentiment and intent throughout the ticket lifecycle. By tracking end users’ predicted sentiment and intent throughout the ticket lifecycle, you can spot trends and address issues early, preventing escalations.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Previously, a ticket’s sentiment and intent were predicted at the start of the ticket conversation.

With this release, a ticket's sentiment and intent predictions update dynamically throughout the ticket conversation.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Having updated sentiment and intent insights throughout a ticket conversation provides even more granular control and better insights to admins and unblocks key use cases, such as:

  • Automatically raising ticket priority when end-user sentiment changes during the conversation.
  • Comparing end-user sentiment from start to finish to identify what’s working well and where agent processes, training, routing, or escalation could improve.
  • Detecting shifts in intent during conversations to take timely actions, such as adjusting agents procedures or rerouting tickets to the best team for faster, more context-aware resolutions.

What do I need to do?

This new experience will be progressively rolled out between May 19th, 2025 and May 23,2025 to all Zendesk customers with the Copilot add-on. To learn more, see Turning on and configuring intelligent triage.

If you’re interested in using the Zendesk copilot add-on, see Buying the Copilot AI add-on or contact your Zendesk account representative.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-05-09
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-05-09
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • AI agents and knowledge
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

AI agents and knowledge

CSAT:

  • The CSAT scale in email has been reverted. It starts from the highest value at the top.

Knowledge:

  • Generative search is generally available.
  • The new article editor rollout plan has been announced.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Ordemio AI Agent for Support (Support)
    • Ordemio AI Agent is an AI-driven support agent that seamlessly integrates with Zendesk to help customer service teams deliver faster, smarter support. It works alongside your human agents to instantly handle common queries using your existing knowledge base and FAQs, deflecting up to 80% of repetitive tickets​. Customers get accurate, 24/7 answers in seconds, which instantly reduces your team’s ticket volume and response times. The result is higher customer satisfaction and agents freed to focus on complex, high-value issues instead of FAQs.
       
  • ManageEngine Log360 Cloud (Support)
    • ManageEngine Log360 Cloud is designed for security analysts and IT administrators who use Zendesk as a part of their IT security and management (ITSM) framework. It enables them to monitor and manage their organization's network security seamlessly and directly from the Zendesk interface. Receive instant security alerts for any detected incidents in your Zendesk environment, enabling you to take swift action and mitigate threats. You can also choose to customize or disable notifications for specific alert profiles, based on your operational needs. Create Zendesk tickets automatically for detected security incidents, assign them to network administrators, manage devices, assign priorities, and update statuses— all from within the Zendesk console, thanks to the two-way sync provided by Log360 Cloud. Further, you can also export the incidents as PDF files.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Copilot
  • Chat and messaging
  • Talk
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA
  • Zendesk WFM

articles.name: Service Incident - May 11, 2025 - All Pods | Zendesk QA is down for multiple customers
articles.title: Service Incident - May 11, 2025 - All Pods | Zendesk QA is down for multiple customers
articles.body:
Summary

On May 11, 2025, from 03:44 UTC to 10:43 UTC, Zendesk QA customers experienced issues loading the Zendesk QA UI, causing the application to display only a loading screen. During this period, some users encountered 404 errors and blank screens.

Timeline

May 11, 2025 10:20 AM UTC | May 11, 2025 03:20 AM PT

We are currently experiencing an outage affecting Zendesk QA for multiple customers. Our team is actively investigating the issue. We will provide the next update in 30 minutes.

May 11, 2025 10:54 AM UTC | May 11, 2025 03:54 AM PT

Our engineering team identified that the issue was due to front-end assets not loading. We redeployed the service, and the issue is now resolved. Zendesk QA is fully operational, and we will continue to monitor for the next 30 minutes. Thank you for your patience.

May 11, 2025 11:39 AM UTC | May 11, 2025 04:39 AM PT

We are happy to report that Zendesk QA is fully operational. Thank you for your patience and understanding while we worked to resolve the issue.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by an error during the preparation of a recent update, which unintentionally included incorrect components in the production environment. As a result, when system updates were applied, some users experienced issues with the application not loading correctly.

Resolution

To fix the issue, the application was updated with the correct version, restoring normal functionality for users.

Remediation Items

  1. Review and improve the update process to prevent incorrect components from being included in future releases.
  2. Strengthen monitoring and alert systems to quickly detect and address issues affecting the user interface.
  3. Introduce additional monitoring to identify unusual drops in application usage that could signal potential problems.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Why can't a Talk Team lead view calls in the Talk live dashboard?
articles.title: Why can't a Talk Team lead view calls in the Talk live dashboard?
articles.body:
Question

Why can't a Talk team lead view calls in the Talk live dashboard?

Answer

Access to the Talk dashboard depends on the user's roles and permissions. These are configured differently depending on your plan.

On non-Enterprise plans, users can be assigned to one of three Talk roles: admin, team lead, or agent. Talk admins and team leads can view the dashboard. Typically, Talk agents can't access the dashboard. However, if a Talk agent is a Support admin, they will have access to the Talk dashboard because Support admins can access the Talk dashboards regardless of their Talk role.  

On Enterprise plans, to view calls in the Talk live dashboard, a user must be assigned to a role with both of the following permissions: Reports permissions > View Talk dashboard  and Channels > Manage channels and extensions. 

For more information on user permissions, see this articles: 

  • Accessing and viewing the Talk dashboard
  • Giving agents access to Talk

articles.name: Service Incident - May 9, 2025 - Multiple Pods | X/Twitter APIs are currently returning Service Unavailable error
articles.title: Service Incident - May 9, 2025 - Multiple Pods | X/Twitter APIs are currently returning Service Unavailable error
articles.body:
Summary

On May 9, 2025, from 16:20 UTC to 18:32 UTC, customers using the Twitter (X) channel integration experienced failures in incoming tickets and agent replies due to a service outage. This resulted in permanent errors when sending or receiving messages through the Twitter Direct Messaging channel, impacting message flow and customer interactions.

Timeline

May 09, 2025 05:41 PM UTC | May 09, 2025 10:41 AM PT

We are aware of a X API v2 outage (see https://docs.x.com/status) that may impact channel integrations with Zendesk services. This can cause incoming tickets and agent replies to/from X Channel Integrations to fail due to the following error: <X::ServiceUnavailable: Service Unavailable: Service Unavailable> Please follow the X.com status updates for more details.

May 09, 2025 07:29 PM UTC | May 09, 2025 12:29 PM PT

The X API v2 issue is resolved as reported on https://docs.x.com/status. At this time all functionality has been restored.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by an outage on the Twitter (X) platform, which affected the availability of their APIs. The disruption led to failed message processing in the Twitter channel integration. There were no secondary causes identified.

Resolution

The issue was resolved once the Twitter (X) APIs returned to normal operation. Our systems resumed normal message processing following the restoration of the external service.

Remediation Items

This issue was caused by a third-party service outage, and therefore, there are no remediation actions required on Zendesk’s part.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Why should I remove legacy DNS entries?
articles.title: Why should I remove legacy DNS entries?
articles.body:
Question

Why should I remove legacy DNS entries?

Answer

Previously, Zendesk recommended adding the four cname records below. We now recommend that you remove these legacy DNS entries. Only legacy customers will have them. While these records will cause no harm, it's best practice to remove non-functional records of any kind.

zendesk1.yourdomain.com >> mail1.zendesk.com
zendesk2.yourdomain.com >> mail2.zendesk.com
zendesk3.yourdomain.com >> mail3.zendesk.com
zendesk4.yourdomain.com >> mail4.zendesk.com

For more information, see this article: Allowing Zendesk to send email on behalf of your email domain.

articles.name: Managing your generative search usage
articles.title: Managing your generative search usage
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Team, Growth, Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support with Guide Professional or Enterprise

Generative search provides AI-generated answers to users' search queries in your help center based on your content. You can monitor generative search usage in your account and manage usage limits as needed. If you reach your usage limit, or expect that you will, you can purchase the Generative Search Extender add-on to perform additional searches.

This article includes the following sections:
  • Generative search usage limits
  • Monitoring generative search usage
  • Increasing your usage limits

Generative search usage limits

All Zendesk Suite and Guide plans include up to 100,000 eligible searches per month that produce generative search results. This includes search queries for supported languages that display generated answers on the search results page.

Monitoring generative search usage

You can monitor your usage summary to determine how close you are to your search usage limit.

To monitor your generative search usage
  1. In Admin Center, click Account in the sidebar, then select Usage > Summary.
  2. Refer to the Generative search box for the number of eligible search queries performed in your account this month, and the number remaining.

Increasing your usage limits

If you exceed 100,000 searches per month, you can buy the Generative Search Extender add-on to perform additional searches. Contact Zendesk Sales to purchase the add-on.

When you reach this limit, Zendesk Sales will contact you with information about the add-on.

articles.name: Why can't I create reports or dashboards in Zendesk Explore?
articles.title: Why can't I create reports or dashboards in Zendesk Explore?
articles.body:
Question

Why can't I create reports or dashboards in Zendesk Explore?

Answer

The reason why you can't create reports or dashboards might be due to plan limitations or permission issues.

Plan limitations

Zendesk Explore offers different plans with varying features. Explore Lite is available with standalone Zendesk Support plans, such as Support Team, Support Professional, and Support Enterprise. Explore Lite agents can only access prebuilt dashboards created by Zendesk. Zendesk Lite plans don't permit users to create custom reports or dashboards.

If your current Explore plan is Explore Lite and you need advanced capabilities consider an upgrade of your Explore plan.

For more information, see these articles: 

  • Checking your plan type or add-ons
  • About the Zendesk Explore plan types

Permission issues

If you have the right subscription plan and still can't create custom reports and dashboards, it might be a user permission issue.

Confirm with your Zendesk admin that your user role includes the necessary permissions to build reports and dashboards. 

For more information, see this article: Giving users access to Explore.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - May 27-28, 2025 | Pods 23 & 19 - Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - May 27-28, 2025 | Pods 23 & 19 - Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for notified customers on Pods 23 and 19 from May 27-28, 2025, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Messaging and Sunshine Conversations

Important:  Only customers who have been notified and have Messaging enabled will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below. Impacted customers will receive a notification banner in their Support instance indicating which window of impact to expect.
Customers Affected: Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations customers on Pods 23 and 19 who have been notified, will experience a service disruption of 40 minutes at some time within the 40 minute maintenance window.

Expected behavior: During the maintenance window, notified accounts attempting to use Messaging will find their accounts locked and will be unable to send outbound messages; instead, they will receive an HTTP 423 response. Messages sent by end-users via social messaging channels for these accounts will be preserved and buffered until the accounts are unlocked.

What do customers have to do? If customers have enabled their own client-side Content Security Policy they must include *.zendesk.com on their allowlist to ensure that their integrations continue to initialize and function.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is rehoming customers accounts to be located in the same data store as their Support accounts increased reliability, performance & data locality.

Expected behavior: During the maintenance window, notified accounts attempting to use Messaging will be locked and unable to send outbound messages; instead, they will receive an HTTP 423 response. Messages sent by end-users via social messaging channels for these accounts will be preserved and buffered until the account is unlocked.

What do customers have to do? If customers have enabled their own client-side Content Security Policy, they must include *.zendesk.com on their allowlist to ensure that their integrations continue to initialize and function.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is rehoming customers accounts to be located in the same data store as their Support accounts increased reliability, performance, and data locality.

articles.name: Service Incident - May 6, 2025 - Multiple Pods | Support - Placeholders in macros are no longer rendering agent aliases; full agent names are being exposed
articles.title: Service Incident - May 6, 2025 - Multiple Pods | Support - Placeholders in macros are no longer rendering agent aliases; full agent names are being exposed
articles.body:
Summary

On May 6, 2025, from 13:10 UTC to 20:59 UTC, Customers utilizing macros in ticket updates encountered an issue where agent names were displayed incorrectly. Instead of showing the agent’s configured alias, the system displayed the agent’s full name in ticket comments. This impacted customers who rely on aliases to maintain privacy or ensure clarity in their communications.

Timeline

May 06, 2025 08:35 PM UTC | May 06, 2025 01:35 PM PT

We are receiving reports of issues incorrectly displaying agent names only when using placeholders in macros with ticket updates when agent aliases should be shown. Trigger-based placeholder updates are not affected. We are investigating and will provide further updates shortly.

May 06, 2025 08:48 PM UTC | May 06, 2025 01:48 PM PT

We have confirmed an issue causing name placeholders in the composer to incorrectly display the agent name rather than their alias and our team is working to revert the responsible deploy. We will share further updates when we have progress on the revert.

May 06, 2025 09:11 PM UTC | May 06, 2025 02:11 PM PT

We are happy to report that the revert has successfully restored expected functionality to name placeholders used in the composer, and agent aliases are rendering as expected at this time. Thank you for your patience during our investigation.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by a software bug introduced during a recent update, which affected the display of agent names when macros added comments to tickets. The system showed full agent names instead of the intended aliases.

Resolution

To fix the issue, the deployment was rolled back to the previous stable version, restoring the correct display of agent aliases in ticket comments.

Remediation Items

  1. Enhance regression testing to better validate the correct display of agent aliases in macros.
  2. Review and refine the notification process related to untested files to strengthen overall test coverage and reduce potential gaps.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - May 21-23, 2025 | Pod 29 - Messaging & Sunshine Conversations
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - May 21-23, 2025 | Pod 29 - Messaging & Sunshine Conversations
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for notified customers on Pod 29 on May 21 - May 23, 2025, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Messaging & Sunshine Conversations

Important: Only customers who have been notified and have Messaging enabled will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below. Impacted customers will receive an in-product banner notification on May 6, 2025.
 
Customers Affected: Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations customers on Pod 29 who have been notified, will experience a service disruption of 40 minutes during the window. Each account will only be impacted by one window, and the specific time is included in a banner alert in the Support product. If you do not receive this alert, you are not impacted.
 

Expected behavior: During the maintenance window, notified accounts attempting to use Messaging will find their accounts locked and unable to send outbound messages and instead will receive an HTTP 423 response. Messages sent by end-users via social messaging channels for these accounts will be preserved and buffered until the account is unlocked.

What do customers have to do? If customers have have enabled their own client-side Content Security Policy than they must include *.zendesk.com on their allowlist to ensure that their integrations continue to initialize and function.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is rehoming customers accounts to be located in the same data store as their Support accounts for increased reliability, performance & data locality.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - May 27, 2025 | Pod 29 | Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - May 27, 2025 | Pod 29 | Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for some customers using Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) on Pod 29 on May 27, 2025, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important:  Only customers with Messaging triggers enabled are impacted by this maintenance window. Admins can check this by browsing to the Messaging triggers page under Admin Center>>Objects and rules. If you see this page, your account will be impacted by this maintenance. If you do not see it, your account will not be affected.

Customers Affected: Some Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging only) customers using our improved Messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of 20 minutes at some time within the 2 hour maintenance window.

Expected behavior: There will be degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 minutes during the window, and your agents may experience delayed ticket creation and end user messages sent through Messaging in Agent Workspace. No data will be lost during this time, and service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes. Outside of the specific window outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do? Customers are recommended not to set ticket status to Closed for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the maintenance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create a new ticket. No further action is required.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend (see article). This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-5-2
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-5-2
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Chat and messaging
  • AI agents and knowledge
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

Chat and messaging

New:

  • Messaging triggers enhancements  
    • Adding suspend user as an action. Customers can now run messaging triggers as an action, allowing users to be suspended in real time during a messaging conversation. See Messaging triggers conditions and actions reference.

    • Historical reporting for OCR queues for email and messaging channels

      As more customers enable omnichannel queues, visibility into how this configuration improves routing efficiency is essential. Therefore, we introduced the following metrics to address the queue performance dataset. See a demo.

      • Queue wait time (Seconds).
      • Inbound and outbound ticket volumes.
      • Tickets transferred in and out of a queue.
      • New tickets entering into the queue.
  • Omnichannel engagements dataset and refreshed agent productivity dashboards (Demo). With the Omnichannel Engagements data set, we enabled supervisors or operations managers to:
    • View interaction “legs” (Engagements) across channels and agents within a ticket’s lifecycle.
    • Monitor agent performance via the updated Agent Productivity dashboards
      • OCR customers  - Omnichannel: Agent productivity with unified states and custom state, and activity
      • Non-OCR customers -  Omnichannel: Agent Productivity

AI agents and knowledge

Fixed:

AI Agents and Knowledge Insights

  • Remediated an edge case where some advanced autoreply automated resolutions were duplicated.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Panic Button (Support) (paid)
    • Panic Button is a lightweight and powerful tool that instantly empowers agents to escalate urgent tickets across your Zendesk environment. With a simple, color-coded button added to the ticket sidebar, your team gains the visibility and responsiveness needed to deliver fast, coordinated support when it matters most.  Give your team access to one-click ticket escalation to selected groups or all agents, and color-based visual indicators based on trigger status and permissions.
  • JSON XML LOG Viewer (Support) (paid)
    • JSON XML LOG Viewer allows support agents to view JSON, XML, LOG, and TXT attachments directly within tickets, eliminating the need to download files before opening them. The app supports syntax highlighting for better readability for agents.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Copilot
  • Talk
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA
  • Zendesk WFM

articles.name: What does the tag silence in calls report mean?
articles.title: What does the tag silence in calls report mean?
articles.body:
Question

When is a call leg tagged with silence? What does the tag silence in calls report mean?

Answer

The tag silence indicates periods when no audio is detected on a call leg. The presence of the silence tag can indicate a technical problem with the call, but is also applied in some situations that don't indicate a problem.

The phone provider used by Zendesk applies this tag under specific technical conditions related to the audio stream between the caller and the system.

Scenarios

  • No audio packets received: If the system stops receiving audio packets, referred as RTP, from one side of the call, the call leg receives the tag silence, even if the interruption is only temporary.
  • Silent audio packets received: If the system continues to receive audio packets, but the packets contain no actual audio, the call leg receives the tag silence. For example:
    • If a call is an automated notification or reminder, the recipient may simply listen without a response, which results in the tag silence.
    • If a caller mutes their phone, based on their device or phone system, this may send silent audio packets or stop sending audio entirely. These situations can trigger the tag silence.
Note: Some phone systems generate comfort noise instead of silence, which may inhibit the application of the tag silence.

How to use the tag silence

Do not use the tag silence on its own to determine call quality or identify problematic calls. It is most effective when combined with other data points, such as high_jitter, high_packet_loss, high_pdd, or high_latency, and user feedback to help identify possible audio issues.

Example

A customer receives an automated reminder call, they listen but don't speak. The call leg may receive the tag silence even though the call functioned as expected.

For more information, see this article: Reporting on network and audio quality for voice.
